alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 13 at 11:09AM CDT until September 14 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Fox River Lower At Waukesha affecting Waukesha County. Root River At Franklin affecting Milwaukee County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM CDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Root River At Franklin. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, A stage of 8.95 feet is the 20 percent chance flood meaning there is a 20 percent chance in any given year of the river reaching this level. A portion of Oakwood Road in southern Milwaukee County is flooded and closed. There is flooding to agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 2.6 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.7 feet on 06/24/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 1 pm...
